snippet: Dennis Guerra, 38, who responded to a blaze in a high-rise in Coney Island, Brooklyn, became the New York Police Department’s first fire fatality in nearly 30 years.
abstract: Police Officer Dennis Guerra dies of severe smoke inhalation while responding to fire in Coney Island, Brooklyn; his partner Police Officer Rosa Rodriquez remains in critical condition; 16-year-old Marcell Dockery has been charged with starting the blaze; Guerra is the New York Police Department's first fire fatality in 30 years.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Kate Pastor, Marc Santora and Michael Schwirtz, and research by Kitty Bennett.

lead_paragraph: Dennis Guerra, 38, who responded to a blaze in a high-rise in Coney Island, Brooklyn, became the New York Police Department’s first fire fatality in nearly 30 years.

headline.main: Police Policy on Fires Is Questioned Amid Grief at Death of a New York Officer
headline.print_headline: Grief at Officer’s Death, and Questions on Policy
